alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 28 at 8:02PM MDT until April 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG TO VERY STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Very low humidities are already in place across much of northern and central New Mexico and will not be able to recover effectively tonight into Friday morning. In addition, a strong system moving east through Rockies Friday will bring increased winds aloft to New Mexico. This will result in widespread critical fire weather conditions for all areas on Friday. Many areas along and south of I-40 and over eastern New Mexico could potentially observe 10-15 consecutive hours of humidity below 10 percent. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands, Northeast Plains, Northwest Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, East Central Plains, West Central Highlands Friday morning through Friday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts between 45 and 60 mph Friday afternoon. The highest winds will be found along the central mountain chain and the highlands to the east. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 10 for 10 to 15 hours Friday. * IMPACTS...Outdoor burning should not be done. Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
